result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments.   DNA surcharges and surcharges  by the end of the sentence.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds. Balance as a condition of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay by the end of the sentence is civil judgment to be entered against defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegally controlled substances.
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended. Random screening.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological speciment for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge.
Court advised defendant the cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within five (5) years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a three (3) year mandatory Initial Confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. King

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A. King not in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (59 pages) commencing 02-18-2016 SENTENCING received and filed.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

Copunt 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years -  concurrent with 14cf1415; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year; pay mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharges and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Michael A. King in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Michael A. King in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Counts 2, 3, & 4 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Michael A. King not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery and a global offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case has been rescheduled. Date previously given by Attorney Wineke for Scheduling Conference of January 27, 2016 was incorrect.
Scheduling Date will be set on February 5, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. All parties have been informed of this date.  Previously set date of January 27, 2016 is vacated.

Defendant Michael A. King in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Michael A. King in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Attorney Wineke informs the Court that the defendant has a lower pending case scheduled before Judge Konkol on January 27, 2016.  Scheduling Conference January 27, 2016

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. SCRAM
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a Valid License.

Defendant Michael A. King in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael A. King in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defense enters a Plea of Not Guilty Plea as to All  Misdemeanor Counts.  

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
